<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Impressive Mount](/Feats.aspx?ID=6289) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 192 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Cavalier](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=244)

**Prerequisites**
[Cavalier Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6286)

</column>

---

You’ve trained your mount to become a powerful force on the battlefield. The mount you gained through the [Cavalier Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6286) feat becomes a mature animal companion, granting it additional capabilities. Your mount has greater independence. During an encounter, even if you don’t use the [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=2400) action, your mount can still use 1 action that round on your turn to [Stride](/Actions.aspx?ID=2305) or [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306). It can do this at any point during your turn, as long as you aren’t currently taking an action. If it does, that’s all the actions it gets that round—you can’t Command it later.

<title level="2">Impressive Mount leads to...</title>
[Incredible Mount](/Feats.aspx?ID=6293)
